intro:
Good Morning Comrade General Zhukov. This is a matter of dire importance. As you know our beloved Stalingrad has been repeatedly bombed and strafed by the German Luftwaffe. Our patriotic partisians and snipers have been holding their own, after the subsequent invasion of our beloved city. The German 6th Army, consisting of Von Paulus & his cronies, and castoffs from the 4th Panzer Division, have besieged the city and are now occupying territory West of the Railway tracks. I have brought in the finest generals & commanders, and one of the most massive attack forces of history, to oust these Fascist sitters from their entrenchments.
"NOT ONE STEP BACK!" proclaims Stalin!
Take Stalingrad back now Comrade, but hurry! Air recon has informed us that the 3rd & 4th Romanian Armies, as well as the Italian 8th Army, are moving in quickly. There is also the report that the German 48th Panzer Division was sent to reinforce Paulus and his low-lifes. Good Luck, Comrade General, Comrade Zhukov, in OPERATION URANUS.

briliant.text: Excellent Job Comrade General.  Stalin will reward you with an experimental prototype to use in your battles.  Congratulations on the shattering of the German 6th Army!  But we cannot be idle!  A Winter Storm is moving in, and the 3rd and 4th Romanian Armies are squatting along the Chir and Don Rivers.  Also, recon reports that the Italian 8th Army is in the area, and that the 48th Panzer Division is moving East quickly.  Smash these invaders now!

lose.text: Sorry Comrade General Zhukov, you have been demoted.  There is work for you in Siberia.  Good Luck with your new endeavors.

tactical.text:
Well, you broke even Comrade General. Though we paid a price!
Congratulations on the shattering of the German 6th Army! But we cannot be idle! A Winter Storm is moving in, and the 3rd and 4th Romanian Armies are squatting along the Chir and Don Rivers. Also, recon reports that the Italian 8th Army is in the area, and that the 48th Panzer Division is moving East quickly. Smash these invaders now!

victory.text:
Good Job Comrade General.
Congratulations on the shattering of the German 6th Army! But we cannot be idle! A Winter Storm is moving in, and the 3rd and 4th Romanian Armies are squatting along the Chir and Don Rivers. Also, recon reports that the Italian 8th Army is in the area, and that the 48th Panzer Division is moving East quickly. Smash these invaders now!

intro:
AIR RECON REPORT

Heavy Italian Army Units in NW Quad. West Quad well fortified. Center Air Field Well-Fortified.

briliant.text:
Absolutely Brilliant, Zhukov, you will be rewarded greatly. Plus I have a case of Stolie's and a box of cigars for you when you return.
Congratulations, but we must push on to Rostov. Despite the Winter Storm that has moved in. There are ragtag units who ran away during Operation Saturn, but they are being reinforced by part of the 48th Panzer Division. Recon tells us they heard of our counterattack, and moved a sizable amount of Heavy Artillery across the river. So send recon and aircraft out first, Comrade. You have the select group of forces from the best armies and divisions, and commendable leaders! Push East Comrade! ON TO ROSTOV!

lose.text: Sorry Zhukov, but I have heard that the cannery in Siberia has openings.  Gen. Yeremenko will be taking over your duties.  Good Luck!

tactical.text:
Well, Zhukov. A manageable, tactical win. But many losses! Our line is wearing thin. If this continues, we will suffer a defeat in the long run. We must send out more recon, before blindly attacking.
Congratulations, but we must push on to Rostov. Despite the Winter Storm that has moved in. There are ragtag units who ran away during Operation Saturn, but they are being reinforced by part of the 48th Panzer Division. Recon tells us they heard of our counterattack, and moved a sizable amount of Heavy Artillery across the river. So send recon and aircraft out first, Comrade. You have the select group of forces from the best armies and divisions, and commendable leaders! Push East Comrade! ON TO ROSTOV!

victory.text:
Good, Good Job, Comrade Zhukov. Still some unexpected losses.
Congratulations, but we must push on to Rostov. Despite the Winter Storm that has moved in. There are ragtag units who ran away during Operation Saturn, but they are being reinforced by part of the 48th Panzer Division. Recon tells us they heard of our counterattack, and moved a sizable amount of Heavy Artillery across the river. So send recon and aircraft out first, Comrade. You have the select group of forces from the best armies and divisions, and commendable leaders! Push East Comrade! ON TO ROSTOV!

intro:
AIR RECON REPORT

Chir River is heavily guarded at most locations. Some air units seen flying East. Reinforcements in the Center vector are forthcoming.

briliant.text: Excellent Job Comrade Zhukov, You were brilliant, and will be amply rewarded!  We have a chance to quickly secure four tactical deployment sites and for our seige of Rostov.  We have to do this very quickly.  And with limited supply and troops.  Bomb the occupied territories, we have the l6th Air Army on the way.  Sieze  the  occupied territories.  Quickly, the full Army is on it's way!

lose.text: Sorry Zhukov, General Rokossovsky is taking over your command.  You are relieved of your duties, and will be an office manager in Moscow.

tactical.text: Well, a win is a win.  But I am getting worried about the loss of too many units for our marrch to Rostov.  We have a chance to quickly secure four tactical deployment sites.  Bomb the occupied territories and seize them with limited recon and units.  Hurry, the rest of the army is on its way

victory.text: Good Job Zhukov, but careful with our units, We will need them, later.  We have a chance to quickly secure four tactical deployment sites and for our seige of Rostov.  We have to do this very quickly.  And with limited supply and troops.  Bomb the occupied territories, we have the l6th Air Army on the way.  Sieze  the  occupied territories.  Quickly, the full Army is on it's way!

intro:
AIR RECON REPORT

No supporting air units spotted for tactical deployment areas to be annexed. Limited troops and recon protecting those areas.

briliant.text: Great Job, Zhukov.  We must now take Rostov, but our reports tell us that Wiking's Panzer Division has reinforced the occupied city hearing of our movements.  Wiking has a sizable amount of Tigers lying in wait, so be sure to employ the recon aircraft that I have sequestred. Our tactical fighters and bombers are being used in Kursk at this time, and will not be available. In addition, Stalin is sending us additional bombers from the 8th Army to aid us in our efforts.  Careful General, a defeat here may mean a loss in the war.  Good Luck & GodSpeed, Comrade!

lose.text: Get Lost Zhukov you can't manage a fishery

tactical.text: Great Job, Zhukov.  We must now take Rostov, but our reports tell us that Wiking's Panzer Division has reinforced the occupied city hearing of our movements.  Wiking has a sizable amount of Tigers lying in wait, so be sure to employ the recon aircraft that I have sequestred. Our tactical fighters and bombers are being used in Kursk at this time, and will not be available. In addition, Stalin is sending us additional bombers from the 8th Army to aid us in our efforts.  Careful General, a defeat here may mean a loss in the war.  Good Luck & GodSpeed, Comrade!

Careful General, a defeat here may mean a loss in the war.  Good Luck & GodSpeed, Comrade!

intro:
AIR RECON REPORT

Several Tigers, anti-tank, and cavalry around the parameters of the city. Air support was seen around the area

briliant.text: Our Marines, Naval Forces, and Air Armies have captured deployment areas near Sevastopol.  Now is the time for us to capture Sevastopol before we head North.  There are some concerns.  Recon tells us that their are some Italian navy units operating in the Black Sea, but most of them are small.  Capture Sevastopol and let us continue this campaign for the liberation of Russia and its homeland.  Good Luck, Zhukov, I am sending you some paratroopers to deploy over key focal points in our attack

lose.text: Sorry Zhukov, Malinowsky will be deployed to the Southwest Line to assume your duties

tactical.text: Our Marines, Naval Forces, and Air Armies have captured deployment areas near Sevastopol.  Now is the time for us to capture Sevastopol before we head North.  There are some concerns.  Recon tells us that their are some Italian navy units operating in the Black Sea, but most of them are small.  Capture Sevastopol and let us continue this campaign for the liberation of Russia and its homeland.  Good Luck, Zhukov, I am sending you some paratroopers to deploy over key focal points in our attack

Good Luck, Zhukov, I am sending you some paratroopers to deploy over key focal points in our attack

intro:
AIR RECON REPORT

Sevastopol may be tough. Several parachute units seen incoming over the Black Sea. Minimal air units, though may be more advanced. The city itself well armed. Russian parachuters on the way. Naval units and some air units already there

briliant.text:
Excellent Job Comrade Zhukov! I'm sure Stalin will reward you greatly!
We are headed North to Odessa. There seems to be some small units on the way. Nothing that you can't take care of. Will report back after we dispose of these runaways! Good Luck Zhukov!

lose.text: Well Zhukov, see you after the war, when you are waiting tables for my dinner party.

tactical.text:
Well, Zhukov you made it a tactical victory, but I am concerned.
We are headed North to Odessa. There seems to be some small units on the way. Nothing that you can't take care of. Will report back after we dispose of these runaways! Good Luck Zhukov!

victory.text:
Good Job Zhukov. A Bit of a Log Jam there, but still a victory.
We are headed North to Odessa. There seems to be some small units on the way. Nothing that you can't take care of. Will report back after we dispose of these runaways! Good Luck Zhukov!

intro:
AIR RECON REPORT

Should only be minor skirmishes. A few recon aircraft reported

briliant.text:
Excellent Job Comrade Zhukov! I'm sure Stalin will reward you greatly!
West to the Sea Comrade! This is going to be a big one! We have Naval Support in the Black Sea for the Naval guns. Plus in a day or two will be sending in some bombing support. Careful, recon tells us mostly anti-tank battalions, small, though they are supported by some heavier ATs. Air intelligence has spotted the Italian Navy to the South, but also two HA railroad guns that could cause some problems, brother. Good Luck Comrade Zhukov, after this we head North to Kiev to reunite with the other generals in their battle.

lose.text: Get Lost Zhukov!

tactical.text:
Excellent Job Comrade Zhukov! I'm sure Stalin will reward you greatly!
West to the Sea Comrade! This is going to be a big one! We have Naval Support in the Black Sea for the Naval guns. Plus in a day or two will be sending in some bombing support. intro:
AIR RECON REPORT

Major anti-tank, and heavy artillery. Italian Navy in the area. Very well-secured. Moderate air units. Two major Railroad guns.

briliant.text: Comrade General Zhukov.  Stalin informs me that the fighting in Kursk was fierce, but the city was finally liberated.  The German battalions have regrouped at Kharkov under the leadership of Generals Von Kleist and Mannheim - remember them?  At least we are pushing them back.  General's Vatutin, Koniev, & Malinowsky are already there to expel the Northern German units on our push to Kiev.  Secure the southern area Comrade until the Generals can eradicate the Northern and Central areas.  It may be wise to wait for them to reinforce you, Kharkov across the river is well-fortified, with Kleist's Panzer Division.  Good Luck General!  I will send some crack parachuters into the Western region as soon as possible to aid your efforts.

lose.text: Have a nice life Zhukov!

tactical.text: Comrade General Zhukov.  Stalin informs me that the fighting in Kursk was fierce, but the city was finally liberated. intro:
AIR RECON REPORT:

Air Recon gunned down over Kharkov. Approach with caution.

briliant.text: Comrade General Zhukov, Excellent Job as usual.  Recon has informed us that there are lingering German units in Kanev, holding line for the bigger battle of Kiev.  I am letting the other generals go to try and encircle Kiev, while you are disposing of the German, and possibly Romanian units holding out there...Good Luck General, on our push to Kiev.  They got a bunch of units out there, especially Heavy Artillery, be careful, and tactful.  Across the river is a Rat's Nest!

lose.text: For me to say anything Zhukov, would be beyond contempt, and lacking in dignity.

tactical.text: Comrade General Zhukov, Excellent Job as usual.  Recon has informed us that there are lingering German units in Kanev, holding line for the bigger battle of Kiev.  I am letting the other generals go to try and encircle Kiev, while you are disposing of the German, and possibly Romanian units holding out there...Good Luck General, on our push to Kiev. They got a bunch of units out there, especially Heavy Artillery, be careful, and tactful.  Across the river is a Rat's Nest!

intro:
AIR RECON REPORT

Only small units within the city parameters. Luftwaffe sorties at the river stopped our further intelligence.

briliant.text: Comrade General Zhukov, Excellent Job!  Onward to Kiev.  This is the Big One!  You will be reuniting with Generals Koniev, Malinowsky, and Vatutin there, as you approach from the South.  They will be working on the Northern and Central Sectors of Kiev.  Do your best to reinforce their efforts.  The Battle has already begun, and we have established bases east of the river.  Good Luck Comrade General.  If we do well here, it may signal the beginning of the end to this war.

lose.text: Comrade General Zhukov, you are no longer a comrade.  Become an expatriat, and leave our beloved mission now.

tactical.text: Comrade General Zhukov, Excellent Job!  Onward to Kiev.  This is the Big One! intro:
AIR RECON REPORT

Recon gunned down over Kiev. Approach with Caution

briliant.text: Comrade General Zhukov!  Excellent!  Excellent!  Despite the heavy casualties.  The other generals will be pushing the front through Poland, and I need you to counter some Romanian resistance in Belgrade. If we can be victorious here, there will be absolutely no chance of getting attacked from behind.  Good Luck, with this win you will be joining the other generals, in the push of the East Front!

lose.text: Comrade General Zhukov! I am sending you to work with the women in the factories.

tactical.text: Comrade General Zhukov!  Excellent!  Excellent!  Despite the heavy casualties.  The other generals will be pushing the front through Poland, and I need you to counter some Romanian resistance in Belgrade. If we can be victorious here, there will be absolutely no chance of getting attacked from behind.  Good Luck, with this win you will be joining the other generals, in the push of the East Front!

intro:
AIR RECON REPORT

Moderate Romanian troops, ATs, & Tanks, minimal air support, some small PZ units.
Problems with the condition of air deployment. Must annex bases for deployment.

briliant.text: Comrade General Zhukov! Excellent Job!  We need to move you and your arms NW to the SE front of Poland.  The Other Generals are there awaiting you, and your fine army battalions.  Good Luck!

lose.text: Comrade General Zhukov! See you back at the office.

tactical.text: Comrade General Zhukov! Excellent Job!  We need to move you and your arms NW to the SE front of Poland.  The Other Generals are there awaiting you, and your fine army battalions.  Good Luck!

victory.text: Comrade General Zhukov! Excellent Job!  We need to move you and your arms NW to the SE front of Poland.  The Other Generals are there awaiting you, and your fine army battalions.  Good Luck!

intro:
AIR RECON REPORT

Recon shot down by Luftwaffe - more forthcoming. Six parachute reinforcements will be
dropped in advanced areas.

briliant.text: Excellent Zhukov, my commendations!  We are approaching Berlin.  The Other armies are poised at the Oder.  We are ready to strike.  We need you to approach from the Southwest as usual.  This war is almost over!

lose.text: Get Lost Zhukov!!!!!!!!!!

tactical.text: Excellent Zhukov, my commendations!  We are approaching Berlin.  The Other armies are poised at the Oder.  We are ready to strike.  We need you to approach from the Southwest as usual.  This war is almost over!

victory.text: Excellent Zhukov, my commendations!  We are approaching Berlin.  The Other armies are poised at the Oder.  We are ready to strike.  We need you to approach from the Southwest as usual.  This war is almost over!

intro:
AIR RECON REPORT

City limits heavily armed. Suprise attack units, scattered around the vicinity.

briliant.text: Excellent Drive Zhukov.  We are now poised to take Berlin!  We hear that the French, American, & British forces are approaching.  But we will strike first!  Good Luck Zhukov!  Their sources are almost depleted, but more support may be on its way, from the other fronts.

lose.text: Get Lost Zhukov

tactical.text: Excellent Drive Zhukov.  We are now poised to take Berlin!  We hear that the French, American, & British forces are approaching.  But we will strike first!  Good Luck Zhukov!  Their sources are almost depleted, but more support may be on its way, from the other fronts.

victory.text: Excellent Drive Zhukov.  We are now poised to take Berlin!  We hear that the French, American, & British forces are approaching.  But we will strike first!  Good Luck Zhukov!  Their sources are almost depleted, but more support may be on its way, from the other fronts.

intro:
AIR RECON REPORT

Air recon evacuated out of the Berlin area, due to Luftwaffe fighters and anti-aircraft deployment

briliant.text: Zhukov now that we have surrounded the city of Berlin.  We have heard of Hitler's death, or suicide, we are not quite sure at this time.  But it appears, the Reichstag had a secret armory, a warehouse, of anti-tank weapons, and heavy artillery.  Overnight, in secret they have barricaded the Reichstag off from the impending forces.  And set up their last hold on the city.  It appears they have stockpiled more than we assumed.  Recon tells us that some fighters and bombers of the Luftwaffe running out of fuel may be approaching the area.  Keep an eye to the sky, and take the Reichstag stronghold.  You will have the support of your other fine generals, as well as the American, British, and French battalions which pushed their way to Berlin.  Good Luck, Zhukov.  This war is almost over.

lose.text: Go make Vodka from potatos Zhukov, at least you can get drunk, you disgrace!

intro:
AIR RECON REPORT

Reichstag supply was greater than imagined. Heavy barricading. Anti-Tank, and Heavy Artillery.

briliant.text: Comrade Zhukov.  Our engineers have barricaded the East side of the city, for what we feel is rightfully ours, after our losses and determination in pushing the German forces back.  Negotiations of the leaders appear to be a bit strained.  And this division of the city of Berlin has us looking over the fortifications at the American, British, and French units.  We are supposed to be allies, so if things get tense on the line of demarcation.  Try to quiet down the troops, and just hold our ground.  Do not fire unless fired upon!  That is an order Zhukov!  Excellent Job in your push to Berlin.  We shall be decorated for our heroism

lose.text: Comrade Zhukov.  Our engineers have barricaded the East side of the city, for what we feel is rightfully ours, after our losses and determination in pushing the German forces back. intro:
AIR RECON REPORT

Moved to respective homebases in Moscow, Leningrad, & Stalingrad

briliant.text: Comrade General Zhukov.  We were attacked ruthlessly without warning by our own allies.  While the great leaders were negotiating, Russian blood was spilled.  I am stepping down from any advice.  It is up to you and General Rokossovsky to consider pushing our so-called allies back to the sea.  If you wish to continue our war, press on General, if not, then stay secure, and wait for the negotiations to end.  The choice is yours General, in my eyes you are the true leader of Russia now.  Whatever your choice Good Luck, and God be with you General.  Further reports will be assigned by another intelligence officer.  Goodbye Zhukov.

intro: A GENERAL'S CHOICE

briliant.text:
INTELLIGENCE REPORT:

We have formed a new Pact of Steel with Germany despite both our losses and resentments. It is in Russia's best interests. The Italian armies have also joined on our quest in the expansion westward. The British, American, and French armies have been pushed back to Dunkirk, while our German allies are successfully occupying the Northern Sectors. In addition, the Italian factions are working through Spain. Take Dunkirk, now while it is vulnerable. Then our new Pact of Steel, can push on to Great Britain.

lose.text:
INTELLIGENCE REPORT:

We have formed a new Pact of Steel with Germany despite both our losses and resentments. It is in Russia's best interests. The Italian armies have also joined on our quest in the expansion westward. The British, American, and French armies have been pushed back to Dunkirk, while our German allies are successfully occupying the Northern Sectors. In addition, the Italian factions are working through Spain. Take Dunkirk, now while it is vulnerable. Then our new Pact of Steel, can push on to Great Britain.

intro: PACT OF STEEL TWO - THE SIEGE OF DUNKIRK

briliant.text:
INTELLIGENCE REPORT:

We are currently crossing the English Channel encountering some resistence from the British,
American, and French factions. Our new allies have naval and air support, and are currently
transporting units for landing. There are also some paratrooper support in the NW quadrant.
For our full air attack to be employed, it is a priority to annex an airbase, otherwise we will be
sunk in the English channel. There is also a necessary deployment zone to annex. Our units
are getting backed-up, and we don't have the transport capabilities for the bigger heavy
artillery. At this point, it may be wise, to cash in a few units for parachutists or Spenaz. Out.

intro:
PACT OF STEEL 2

THE ENGLISH CHANNEL - OPERATION NEXUS

briliant.text:
INTELLIGENCE REPORT:

While our other armies are working in the Northern vectors of England, we need you to annex the Southernmost part, before you are directed towards Windsor, and ultimately the encirclement of England. We have established an airbase for you, and provided air, sea, and ground support. Out.

intro:
PACT OF STEEL 2

ANNEXATION OF SOUTH ENGLAND

briliant.text:
INTELLIGENCE REPORT:

The other armies are pushing towards London from the North, you are now in a position to take Windsor. Airbases have been established, and there are some ground units in the area. Windsor appears to be heavily fortified with all types of weapons. Out.

intro:
PACT OF STEEL 2

WINDSOR 1946

briliant.text:
INTELLIGENCE REPORT:

The German units are now at the Northeast parameters of London. While our paratroopers and other ground units have annexed some key tactical positions for the encirclement and defeat of London. Air recon has identified some vacant areas in the middle of the city, where you will be reinforced by air drops. Also reinforcements may be issued from the East which seems a tactical weak point for the British. London is heavily armed with air and ground support. Out.

intro:
PACT OF STEEL 2

LONDON BLITZ

briliant.text:
INTELLIGENCE REPORT:

You are to accompany an air and naval attack off the Florida Coast. It is protected by a small group of destroyers, and air support. The German Wolfpack, along with some of our bigger destroyers will assist in the attack. Once annexed we can attack the USA. Great Britain, and France have capitulated. There will be no reinforcements in this siege. Thier radar units have not picked up our deployments at this time. Out.

intro:
PACT OF STEEL 2

TO THE SEA, TO AMERICA

briliant.text:
INTELLIGENCE REPORT:

You are to annex a tactical point off the east coast of Florida, while our other armies are attacking northern points. You will not have full air support until you annex an airbase. Out.

intro:
PACT OF STEEL 2

FLORIDA LANDING

briliant.text:
INTELLIGENCE REPORT:

Savannah is well-fortified, but an airbase was taken. You are provided with naval and air support. Reinforcements are forthcoming. The Northern armies are pushing Southward and Westward from the Ocean towards Washington. Out
